result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Dinolfo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ($243.00) Costs Waived by the Court.  Domestic Violence Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.

No violent contact with J.D.
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.
DNA Surcharge Waived.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M Dinolfo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason M Dinolfo in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with J.D.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
COSTS:  $243.00 of the costs Waived by the Court. ($100.00 DV assessed to be paid as a condition of probation.)
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 Waived by the Court. 
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason M Dinolfo in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets this matter for trial.  Court will conduct voir dire at the jury trial.  Parties have until the Jury status hearing to submit questions.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Dinolfo in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant cannot afford an attorney and does not qualify for a public defender.  Defendant wishes to review discovery.  Court adjourns this matter.  Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Jennifer D.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Jason M Dinolfo in court.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
